text:
FWIW, the `*ˡ` always rendered just fine for me on Firefox on Mac.

It was only the `ₘ` and the `ₙ` that Mac had trouble with. (They work for me fine now, after installing DejaVu Sans Mono, but I guess other users will still have trouble with them, if they don't have those fonts installed.)

elements.text: always rendered just fine for me on Firefox on Mac.
that Mac had trouble with. (They work for me fine now, after installing DejaVu Sans Mono, but I guess other users will still have trouble with them, if they don't have those fonts installed.)

text: Yeah, I think the risk of people not being able to render the fonts is high enough to warrant replacing them with regular `Cmn`.

text:
I'll make a PR to change `Cₘₙ` to `Cmn` in the README and in the documentation.

I noticed that those subscripts also appear in the source code and the tests. Do you want me to also change them in the source code and the tests? Or just the README and the documentation?

text:
Hopefully people's editors have more unicode support, but it'd probably be safer to change all of the.
E.g., maybe someone wants to look at the code through vim running in Cygwin? That may not render correctly.
